main_definition: Watt is a unit of power in the International System of Units (SI) that measures the rate at which energy is transferred or converted.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used to describe someone who works hard and is very energetic, originating from the wattage of electricity indicating power
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite his young age, Tim works like a watt; he's always at the office even after others have left.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In internet slang, it refers to the number of views on a YouTube video or page.
meanings_and_examples.example: The 'wattage' of that gaming tutorial has gone up significantly since its last upload.
